main_definition: An investment refers to the allocation of resources, typically money, with an expectation of generating income or profit over time.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Financial commitment towards a project or asset for potential future benefit
meanings_and_examples.example: John invested $10,000 in stocks to potentially earn higher returns.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Allocation of funds into various assets (like real estate, bonds, stocks) with the goal of increasing wealth over time
meanings_and_examples.example: Sarah decided to diversify her portfolio by investing in both real estate and technology companies.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Placement of capital into a business venture or enterprise for profit generation
meanings_and_examples.example: The company made an investment in the new startup, hoping to see a return on their funds as it grows.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Using money or resources with the expectation that they will increase in value over time
meanings_and_examples.example: Saving and investing early can help people reach financial independence due to the power of compounding interest.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The act of putting trust, support, or energy into something for future gain
meanings_and_examples.example: She considered her time at university as an educational investment in her personal and professional growth.
